question:
On November 14th 2014, Rosetta project operated by European Space Agency has successfully landed its spacecraft on the surface of comet C67/P Churyumov-Gerasimenko. The landing was hard process, but a great achievement because of the following reason, except...

  1. The comet exerts a very low gravitational force to the spacecraft.
  2. there are so many debris encircling the comet.
  3. the spacecraft bounced several times before it actually landed.
  4. at that time, the comet was located very far away from Earth, outside the orbit of Neptune.
